text.text: The Acorn Atom is a personal computer manufactured by Acorn Computers from 1980 to 1982, when it will be replaced by the BBC Micro. It was billed as an upgrade to the Atom, originally known as the Proton. It was a miniaturized Acorn System 3, without a floppy disk drive, but with an integrated keyboard and a cassette player. It embarked a MOS 6502 processor at 1Mhz and 2 kb of RAM expandable to 12. It could display a resolution up to 64x192 in 4 colors or 256x192 in monochrome. For sound, a simple internal speaker on 1 channel.
